intro: Trichilia lepidota subsp. leucastera, commonly known as the white-veined trichilia, is a tropical tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent white veins, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces woody fruits containing several seeds. The species is valued for its durable timber and has traditional uses in local communities.
